title: First a straw, now a fork. Turtles are choking on our plastic trash.
body: Back in August, we watched as marine biologist Dr Nathan Robinson struggled to remove a straw from a turtle's nose while on board a research vessel in Costa Rica. The troubling video went viral ...
readable_content: - EarthTouch (2023-12-08): The article "First a straw, now a fork. Turtles are choking on our plastic trash" discusses the issue of plastic pollution in the oceans, particularly its impact on turtles. The article highlights the case of a marine biologist, Dr. Nathan Robinson, who removed a plastic fork from a turtle's nostril, similar to his previous experience with a straw. The piece also emphasizes the scale of the problem, stating that eight million metric tons of plastic pollution are dumped in the oceans each year. The author urges people to reduce, reuse, and recycle to make a difference and provides a link to an organization dedicated to turtle conservation.
summary:
